heading: informix posts a surprise
subheading: analysts expected a loss, but the database company said it earned nearly us$5 million. also: adaptec's slight disappointment.... quarterdeck crashes.
author: wired news report
text: surprising wall street analysts were expecting a loss of 4 cents a share, according to a recent survey by zacks investment research. informix writes computer programs that help big companies store vast libraries of business information (such as customer names and inventory lists) on their computer networks. last year in the same quarter it reported a devastating loss they attributed to over-aggressive sales tactics and weak demand for new products.- - - slight disappointment: - - - ouch: reuters contributed to this report.
